revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - The reservations spoken of by Gonis will appear in the history. That suffices, I think.

Vote - AcceptText - Fine, but with some reservations over Α(ὐρήλιος) in lin2. Ed.'s Σ̣αρ̣άμ[μ]ων tries to account for the apparent ink before the first α; the abbreviation stroke is mostly a guess (but so is also ρ), and the same(?) hand abbreviates Αὐρήλιος differently in lin7.

Submit - As explained in the introduction, I've entered a revised text of this receipt. The new readings come from D. Hagedorn, who communicated them to me in a couple of emails sent in early March 2015.
Finalized - This is good to go.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - This looks good: add accent in line 4, fix number tags in line 6, and correct spelling and unresolved abbr. in line 7. Final check of text still required, and file will need to be renamed in finalization.
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)

div.p: This edition of P.Fay. 242 revises the one published in ZPE 193 (2015) 226-230. It is based on readings proposed by D. Hagedorn to R. Ast in emails from early March 2015. The line notes directly quote (in German) Hagedorn's remarks or summarize them (in English).

div.ab:
Μεσορὴ κδ παρήνεγκενπαρηγκενπαρέσχεπαρήσκεν
Αὐρήλιος ἌμμωνΣαράμμων Ἡρακλείδου
ὑπὲρ κισδηδροδοκομιδῆς ῥόδων
ἐν κώμῃ Νέστου χόρτουἐν κώμῃ Εὐημερίας τοῦ χόρτου
λίτρας ἸταλικὰςἸταλικὲς ἑκατὸν
τεσσεράκοντα τέσσεραςτέσσερες.
λίτρας ρμδ
Αὐρήλιος Μαρ
Αὐρήλιος Μαρελλ σεσημείωμαι.

item.p: In Z. 1 scheint mir in παρησκεν das Sigma falsch zu sein. Ich lese παρηγκεν und halte das für ein Versehen des Schreibers anstelle von παρήνεγκεν. In der DDbDP findet man sehr zahlreiche zeitgleiche Quittungen, hauptsächlich aus dem Arsinoites und zumal aus Karanis, die ebenso (d.h. mit Monat, Tag, παρήνεγκε) beginnen. Die allermeisten sind Ostraka aus Karanis (O.Mich.), aber es gibt auch andere Herkunft und auch Papyri. Es geht in der Regel um die Ablieferung von ἄχυρον oder anderen Produkten (Getreide). χόρτος paßt durchaus dazu.

The name Αὐρήλιος Ἄμμων is a very tentative suggestion. After the initial alpha there is a stroke, which could be explained as an abbreviation mark. The abbreviation α for Αὐρήλιος is occasionally found in documents of the period.
What is expected in this line is a reference to the year in which the delivery was due, but the surviving letters are not consistent with a year or indiction.
